content.description: Hereditary spherocytosis <math alttext="open parenthesis, H S, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(HS)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is a disorder of red blood cells that causes the cells to be smaller and spherical instead of having the usual flattened, biconcave shape. The average diameter of normal red blood cells is <math alttext="7.2 micrometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the average diameter of red blood cells in a person with <math alttext="H S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was found to be <math alttext="6.7 micrometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The normal red blood cell has an average surface area of <math alttext="136 micrometers squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>136</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and an average volume of <math alttext="91 micrometers cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>91</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following provides an accurate calculation of the surface area to volume ratio of an <math alttext="H S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> red blood cell, as well as a prediction of its effect on the efficient transferring of oxygen compared to a normal red blood cell?

choices.label: The ratio is <math alttext="0.45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.45</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the cells are more efficient at transferring oxygen.
The ratio is <math alttext="1.12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>1.12</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the cells are less efficient at transferring oxygen.
The ratio is <math alttext="0.89" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.89</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the cells are less efficient at transferring oxygen.
The ratio is <math alttext="141" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>141</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the cells are more efficient at transferring oxygen.

content.answer: The ratio is <math alttext="0.89" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.89</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the cells are less efficient at transferring oxygen.

skill.text: 5.A: Perform mathematical calculations, including: i. mathematical equations in the curriculum ii. means iii. rates iv. ratios v. percentages and percent changes
